newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo rubber futures slip on profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo rubber futures slip on profit-taking.

text.p: Tokyo rubber futures ended lower across the board on Thursday as profit-taking sales surfaced after most of the futures broke above Wednesday"s strong resistance of 160 yen, traders said.
Prices ranged from 1.5 yen to 3.5 yen per kg lower. Benchmark July was off 1.5 yen at 157.6 yen.

The market started the day on a weaker tone, shrugging off the yen"s weaker tendency and the firmer Thai rubber offer prices to Japan. "It was quite natural for the market to experience a technical correction after recent price rises," one trader said. -- Tokyo Commodities Desk +81-3-3432-7431
